X-2024060422-Flammable Liquid Hazmat package found wet. Upon inspection found that 4 cans of Super Tech small engine 2 cycle premixed gas & oil have product residue on the top of the cans indicating leakage and the outer packaging is also wet.

item.title: Report E-2024060495
item.description:
Report E-2024060495

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 3-ounces of P68 Primer for PVC was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to a nail puncture from the pallet. The release impacted trailer #3191047. No oil dri was used, the spill was contained inside the box. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report X-2024061351
item.description:
Report X-2024061351

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: MIAMI GARDENS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SEVEN AIR PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 10 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED PERISHABLE, RUSH, THIS SIDE UP AND HAVE ORIENTATION ARROWS. PERISHABLE IS HANDWRITTEN ON ONE OF THE BOXES. ALL BOXES HAVE AN ADDITIONAL STICKER PREPRINTED COMPANY NAME, CORTE ARGENTINO, BOOTH #2477, CONTACT +1 (305) 586-7277. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z2TT2051331949683, 1Z2TT2051313053522, 1Z2TT2050227616847, 1Z2TT2050225556068, 1Z2TT2050233077632 AND 1Z2TT2050239797657. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024060459
item.description:
Report E-2024060459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, NINE SKIDS MOVING TO COLOMBIA VIA UPS AIR CARGO SERVICE WERE FOUND CONTAINING BOXES WITH COVERED LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS. ALL NINE SKIDS ARE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS INDICATORS ON THE OUTER COVERING. A TOTAL OF 23 BOXES EACH CONTAINING 72 WIRELESS LITHIUM-ION BATTERY POWERED MYJOY COOL EARBUDS WERE FOUND. DURING FORKLIFT MOVEMENT OF THE SKIDS, WE CAN SEE LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS UNDERNEATH ON THE VERY BOTTOM OF THE FREIGHT. THE AIR WAYBILL DOES NOT INDICATE LITHIUM BATTERIES ARE BEING SHIPPED TO COLOMBIA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY PART OF THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED FREIGHT. EHMA EXPRESS INC, 8509 NW 68TH ST, MIAMI FL 33166 IS THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENCY ON THE AIR WAYBILL. SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS IS SUNRISE FINANCIAL BUSINESS, S.A. C/O FIFO WIRELESS, INC, 10900 NW 21ST STREET SUITE 210, MIAMI FL 33172.

item.description:
Report E-2024060430

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: RIVERVIEW
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10150
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver failed to secure the dome lid on the trailer. As he was navigating the shipper location to exit, approximately 50 gallons of phosphoric acid was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
